radiographic_examinations.findings: Imaged lung bases are clear; liver demonstrates homogeneous attenuation with no focal lesions or biliary dilatation; pancreas has normal attenuation with no focal lesions; spleen shows normal size and attenuation; right adrenal nodule measuring 1.1 cm, stable in size from MRI; bilateral kidneys show stable subcentimeter intermediate density cysts; fluid filled appendix dilated with thickened walls, maximum diameter of 12 mm; uterus appears small, question supracervical hysterectomy versus atrophy; no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy; mild degenerative changes in lower thoracic and lumbar vertebral bodies.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The right adrenal nodule and renal cysts are stable in size from previous studies.
